definition: gap (between two objects)/interval of time (between events)/opening in one's schedule/free time/(fig.) gap (in the market etc)
official records/grade (of goods)/file/records/shelves/slot/gap/crosspiece/classifier for crosspieces/classifier for events, affairs etc/Taiwan pr. [dang3]

sentences.english: A check box is toggled by pressing the spacebar.
sentences.chinese: 一個複選框可通過單擊空檔鍵進行切換。

sentences.english: One popular option for "gappers" is international volunteer work.
sentences.chinese: 但是，空檔年最流行的還是跨國志願者工作。

sentences.english: MIT's deferments have doubled in the past year.
sentences.chinese: 去年，麻省理工的“空檔年”學生也翻了一番。

sentences.english: They appeared full, but no, there was one empty cubicle.
sentences.chinese: 看上去已經滿員的廁所裏還有一個空檔位。

sentences.english: I preferred to use the measurement of ullage .
sentences.chinese: 都行，但我更喜歡測量空檔。

sentences.english: Do not coast with your foot on the clutch pedal.
sentences.chinese: 不得踏下離合器踏板，空檔滑行。

sentences.english: This provides useful information and advice for prospective gap-year students.
sentences.chinese: 該網站爲空檔年學生們提供了大量有用信息。

sentences.english: Use the slow period to take some time to write several guest articles for prominent blogs in your industry.
sentences.chinese: 利用這些空檔來爲當屬行業中的博客寫點文章投稿吧。

sentences.english: The Earth would easily fit below the prominence on the right.
sentences.chinese: 地球可以輕易地塞到右邊那個日珥的下面空檔裏。

definition: to seize an opportunity/to take advantage of situation
slot within a schedule/timeslot (for a TV program, a session with a photographer etc)/range of dates in which an event is to be held (film screening, exhibition etc)
cast and crew/performers and production team
lit. to rush at thin air/fig. to miss one's aim/to have nothing to show for one's troubles
to watch a TV series etc regularly/to binge-watch
to rush (to do sth urgent)/to try to be the first/to forestall
